com.twiddles.ganesha.functionality
Interface RDFResource

All Known Implementing Classes:
JenaResource
public interface RDFResource

Interface for querying and modifying RDF resources. A resource may have some properties describing it. Each property statement in RDF has 3 parts: the subject which is the resource being described, the predicate which is the type of property of the resource being described and the object which is the value of that property.

A resource is usually identified by a URI, unless it is an anonymous resource. An anonymous resource implies that it is a thing that has properties but does not (yet) have a URI that identifies it. Anonymous resources are usually the object of other resource's properties.

See Also:
RDFProperty, RDFPredicate, RDFObject

Method Detail

getURI

java.lang.String getURI()
Returns the URI of this resource. If the resource is anonymous this will return some internal identifier to differentiate this anonymous resource from others.

Returns:
this resource's URI
See Also:
isAnonymous()

getProperties

RDFProperty[] getProperties()
Returns all the properties describing this resource.

Returns:
array of the properties

addProperty

void addProperty(RDFPredicate prop,
                 RDFObject obj)
Adds a property describing this resource.

Parameters:
prop - the predicate (aka property) of the statement to be added
obj - the object (aka value) of the statement to be added

delete

void delete()
Deletes all properties of this resource.

isAnonymous

boolean isAnonymous()
Checks if this is an anonymous resource.

Returns:
if anonymous or not

getType

java.lang.String getType()
Returns the type of this resource. If the resource has an rdf:type property whose object is a resource then that resource's URI is returned. In any other case null will be returned.

Returns:
resource's type

getTypeDescr

java.lang.String getTypeDescr()
Returns a short description of the type of this resource. If this resource has no type null will be returned

Returns:
description of resource's type

setType

void setType(java.lang.String uri)
Sets the type of this resource. An rdf:type property with the resource specified by the given URI will be added to this reosurce.

Parameters:
uri - the URI identifying this type.

delType

void delType()
Removes the type property of this resource.
